page.title: 03Sandhurst/Crowthorne History
page.content: {Crowthorne }was a place in Windsor Forest where three Rides met. The Devil's Highway was a Roman road that linked London with Silchester passing through Crowthorne via Caesars camp and Heath Pool, this route can still be walked today. In 1819 Crowthorne was not marked on the map but the development of the railway through the area caused the establishment of Wellington College and eventually Broadmoor with its accompanying houses. Today Crowthorne has become an expensive residential area with executive housing developments.The woodland areas of chestnut,birch,pine and rhododendron are National Trust which includes Simons Wood and the Finchampstead Ridges. It is a communter area and although having some very good shops many people look to Bracknell ,Wokingham or Reading.
